thread.title: Chance the Rapper’s '10 Day' Was Fraudulently Uploaded to iTunes
thread.title_full: Chance the Rapper’s '10 Day' Was Fraudulently Uploaded to iTunes

author: Hypebeast (info@hypebeast.com)
title: Chance the Rapper’s '10 Day' Was Fraudulently Uploaded to iTunes
text:
If you're a fan of Chance the Rapper, you'd probably know that the Chicago emcee's mixtapes have always been available for free. Earlier, however, his 2012 debut tape 10 Day was listed to be on sale in the iTunes stores and on Apple Music. Fret not, Chance has not taken back his promise or become a sell out in any way. He addressed the confusion on Twitter, saying that the project has been "fraudulently" uploaded. He assures: "It'll be down shortly. 10 Day and Acid Rap will always be inclusive, elusive and free.” Check out his tweet below. His project is currently removed from iTunes.
10day was fraudulently put on iTunes and applemusic. It'll be down shortly. 10day and acid rap will always be inclusive, elusive and free
— Lil Chano From 79th (@chancetherapper) January 8, 2017 

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast.com
